manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Long-Description: Jindent is a powerful source code formatter for Java. Jindent empowers you to transform any foreign Java source code to meet your preferred coding style or any common Java code convention. Furthermore Jindent can format, generate and complete Javadoc comments on demand.
manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Module-Dependencies: org.netbeans.modules.editor/3 > 1.26.1.1, org.netbeans.modules.editor.lib/1 > 1.9.1.1, org.netbeans.modules.options.api/0 > 1.3.1, org.openide.actions > 6.5.1, org.openide.filesystems > 6.4.1, org.openide.loaders > 5.9.1, org.openide.nodes > 6.7.1, org.openide.text > 6.9.1, org.openide.util > 6.8.1, org.openide.windows > 6.5.1
manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Short-Description: Jindent is a powerful source code formatter for Java.

manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Long-Description: XTT 5.8.7 Core. XTT is an enterprise application assembly framework for Java Swing. It uses wizards and SOA to deliver web distributable Java Swing applications. Some key features are: automated relational and POJO data binding along with synchronization between tiers. (More Info: http://www.insitechinc.com)">
manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Module-Dependencies: com.itgp.nb.support > 5.8.1, com.itgp.nb.thirdparty > 5.7.0, javax.jmi.model/1 > 1.7.22, javax.jmi.reflect/1 > 1.7.22, org.apache.tools.ant.module/3 > 3.24.22.1, org.jdesktop.layout/1 > 1.3.1, org.netbeans.api.java/1 > 1.10.1, org.netbeans.api.mdr/1 > 1.4.22, org.netbeans.jmi.javamodel/2 > 1.21.22, org.netbeans.modules.autoupdate/1 > 2.16.1, org.netbeans.modules.editor/3 > 1.26.22.1, org.netbeans.modules.editor.lib/1 > 1.9.22.1, org.netbeans.modules.java/1 > 1.25.22.2.2.2, org.netbeans.modules.java.editor/1 > 1.4.22, org.netbeans.modules.java.platform/1 > 1.7.22, org.netbeans.modules.java.project/1 > 1.8.1, org.netbeans.modules.javacore/1 > 1.18.22.2.2, org.netbeans.modules.project.ant/1 > 1.12.22, org.netbeans.modules.project.libraries/1 > 1.13.1, org.netbeans.modules.projectapi/1 > 1.9.1, org.netbeans.modules.projectuiapi/1 > 1.13.1.5, org.netbeans.modules.queries/1 > 1.7.22, org.netbeans.modules.utilities/1 > 1.21.22, org.netbeans.spi.palette/1 > 1.5.1, org.openide.actions > 6.5.22, org.openide.awt > 6.7.1, org.openide.dialogs > 6.5.1, org.openide.execution > 1.8.22, org.openide.explorer > 6.5.1, org.openide.filesystems > 6.4.1, org.openide.io > 1.9.22, org.openide.loaders > 5.9.1, org.openide.modules > 6.5.1, org.openide.nodes > 6.7.1, org.openide.src > 1.8.22, org.openide.util > 6.8.1, org.openide.windows > 6.5.1

manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Long-Description: XTT 5.8.7 Support Base. This module contains the XTT Javadoc and product documentation.

XTT 5.8.7 Third Party Jars. This module contains some of the third party resources that needed or used by XTT: the Apache Axis2 jars, the InterSystems Cache' database jar, the Hibernate 3 OPL jars, HSQLDB jar, and the Java Web Start jar.

3.3. Trademarks. This EULA does not grant you any rights in connection with any trademarks or service marks of InsiTech.

InsiTech will not utilize such technical information in a form that personally identifies you.

3.7.2. Effect of Termination. Within thirty (30) days after the date of termination or discontinuance of your EULA to use the SOFTWARE PRODUCT for any reason whatsoever, you shall destroy the SOFTWARE PRODUCT and all copies, in whole or in part, all documentation relating thereto, and any other InsiTech confidential information in your possession that is in tangible form.

13. DEFINITIONS.
13.1. "DEVELOPMENT USE" means use of the SOFTWARE PRODUCT by a Development Use customer to design, develop and/or test new applications for PRODUCTION USE.
13.2. "Documentation" means InsiTech's then current user manuals, operating instructions and installation guides generally provided with the SOFTWARE PRODUCT to its licensees.
13.3. "Error" means a failure of the SOFTWARE PRODUCT to conform to the specifications as set forth in the Documentation, resulting in the inability to use the SOFTWARE PRODUCT or a material restriction in use of the SOFTWARE PRODUCT.
13.4. "Maintenance Release" means a subsequent version of the Software that includes Updates and/or Upgrades.
13.5. "PRODUCTION USE" means using the SOFTWARE PRODUCT in your application for internal business purposes only, which may include third party customers' access to, or use of such applications as part of your regular business and in accordance with procedures established and enforced by you. PRODUCTION USE does not include the right to reproduce the SOFTWARE PRODUCT for sublicensing, resale, or distribution, including without limitation, operation on a time sharing or service bureau basis or distributing the SOFTWARE PRODUCT as part of an ASP, VAR, OEM, distributor or reseller arrangement. You may enter into a reseller or redistribution agreement but terms of such an agreement will be provided in a separate document that will supercede only those sections of EULA that deal with production use and reselling licenses of the SOFTWARE PRODUCT without that agreement in place any and all such redistribution activities are expressly prohibited.
13.6. "Server" means a single computer processor capable of executing the SOFTWARE PRODUCT.
13.7. "Site" means the specific, physical location of a Server, as set forth on your registration form.
13.8. "SOFTWARE PRODUCT " means the object code versions, extracts and/or derivative works of the software electronically downloaded from InsiTech's website upon acceptance of this Agreement, and the related Documentation, including Maintenance Releases provided pursuant to the standard Support Services Terms and Conditions.
13.9. "Update" means either a Software modification or addition that, when made or added to the Software, corrects the Error, or a procedure or routine that, when observed in the regular operation of the Software, eliminates the practical adverse effect of the Error on customer.
13.10. "Upgrade" means a revision of the SOFTWARE PRODUCT released by InsiTech to its end user customers generally, during the Support Services Term, to add new and different functions or to increase the capacity of the SOFTWARE PRODUCT. Upgrade does not include the release of a new product or added features for which there may be a separate charge. If a question arises as to whether a new product offering is an Upgrade or a new product or feature, InsiTech's opinion will control, provided that InsiTech treats the product offering as a new product or feature for its end user customers generally.
